The disease is one of the main reasons for the decline in vision in the Western world.";}i:13;O:8:"stdClass":3:{s:2:"id";s:2:"15";s:14:"dictionary_key";s:50:"glaucoma_is_a_group_of_eye_diseases_all_of_which_h";s:5:"value";s:196:"Glaucoma is a group of eye diseases, all of which have damage to the optic nerve. In the initial stages, the damage causes damage to the peripheral vision, and the patient does not feel this harm.";}i:14;O:8:"stdClass":3:{s:2:"id";s:2:"16";s:14:"dictionary_key";s:9:"read_more";s:5:"value";s:9:"read more";}i:15;O:8:"stdClass":3:{s:2:"id";s:2:"17";s:14:"dictionary_key";s:2:"dr";s:5:"value";s:3:"Dr.";}i:16;O:8:"stdClass":3:{s:2:"id";s:2:"18";s:14:"dictionary_key";s:50:"dr_skaat_is_a_graduate_of_the_sackler_school_of_me";s:5:"value";s:721:"<p>Dr. Skaat is a graduate of the Sackler School of Medicine, Tel Aviv University. Specialized in ophthalmology at the Medical Center “Sheba”, Tel Hashomer, and expertised in the field of glaucoma and cataract at the prestigious New York Eye &amp; Ear Infirmary of Mount Sinai in Manhattan, New York, which is one of the leading centers in this field.</p>
<p>Dr. Alon Skaat is an expert ophthalmologist with expertise in the field of glaucoma-and cataract. He is a senior physician and surgeon in the Department of Ophthalmology of Medical Center “Sheba”, Tel Hashomer. He is also a Lecturer at the Sackler School of Medicine, Tel Aviv University, and a member of the Israeli Association of Ophthalmologists.</p>
